item.title: ‘Dog Bar Sarasota’ celebrates grand opening with foam party and other activities
item.description: Connect with other dog owners and let your furry friends have some free-roaming fun!

item.title: Carter Layne pleads no contest in manslaughter case
item.description: Carter Layne pleads no contest in manslaughter case

item.title: Carter Layne pleads no contest in shooting of Manatee High wrestler
item.description: Sentencing has been deferred until Sept. 24, court records show.

item.title: Facing scrutiny, Sarasota clerk’s proposed $44K raise to be pulled from agenda
item.description: The raise would boost Clerk Shayla Griggs’ salary from $196,247 to $240,000.

item.title: Credit Union on Clark Road robbed for second time in a month; suspect sought
item.description: Can you help identify this man?

item.title: Coast Guard cutter returns to St. Petersburg after seizing over $90M worth of drugs
item.description: 59-day patrol, 3 vessels intercepted, millions in drugs seized.

item.title: Florida attorney general identifies wrongful charges under halted immigration law
item.description: At least two people have been wrongly charged under a Florida law that outlaws people living in the U.S. illegally from entering the state since a federal judge halted its enforcement.

item.title: Multiple departments respond to Charlotte County boat storage facility fire
item.description: Charlotte County Public Safety says the cause of the fire is electrical undetermined.

item.title: Florida governor says Everglades restoration project is five years ahead of schedule
item.description: Originally slated to be finished in 2034, the Everglades restoration project is now expected to be completed in 2029, according to DeSantis.

item.title: Sarasota County Fire Station 21 hosts Open House for Venice community
item.description: These open houses run year long and travel to different fire stations around the county.

item.title: Florida ranks #1 for religious liberty in the U.S., Governor Ron DeSantis says
item.description: Florida was named the new number one state in the nation when it comes to protecting spiritual freedoms as part of The Religious Liberty in The United States 2025 annual report.

item.title: Sizzling Sunday ahead, but stormier skies are coming soon
item.description: Heat indices near 110 and rain chances stay low Sunday.
